meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Get ready to dive into the world of otome visual novels with Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling! This sequel has got everyone talking, from NintendoWorldReport's glowing review to Gamer Escape's, well, not-so-glowing review. Let's get this love fest started and see what all the fuss is about!

For those who skipped the original game, don't worry; Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling is designed to be a standalone experience. The reviewer from God is a Geek says it's hard to get into without playing the first game, but that just means you'll have even more to look forward to if you do decide to play both! On the other hand, Cubed3 claims it's "easy-to-use menus and wildly different plot routes" that make this sequel so appealing.

But what about the actual gameplay? Well, Digitally Downloaded thinks it's all about the aesthetics and presentation - and I'm totally down with that! Who wouldn't want to immerse themselves in a colorful world of love and romance? Tech-Gaming agrees, saying it's all about "the full journey" where flawed bachelors flourish thanks to the virtues of romance.

Of course, not everyone is as enamored. Gamer Escape thinks it should've been DLC instead, citing a lack of world-building and character development. Ouch! GLHF on Sports Illustrated even goes so far as to say it feels "confused and lost" at times - but hey, at least it's trying something new!

So, what do I think? Well, I think Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling is a wild ride full of surprises (and maybe a little bit of chocolate). If you're looking for a lighthearted, entertaining otome visual novel with plenty of romance and humor, this might just be the one for you!

Time to wrap it up and say goodbye to our lovelorn Lynette. Until next time, stay groovy and keep on gaming!
